title: IHEC Data Hub Sample schema
description: The IHEC Data Hub Sample schema covers all metadata requested by IHEC Metadata Standards, as specified here: https://github.com/IHEC/ihec-metadata/blob/master/specs/Ihec_metadata_specification.md

sample_ontology_curie.description: (Ontology: EFO) links to sample ontology information.

disease_ontology_curie.description: (Ontology: NCIM) links to sample disease ontology information. This property reflects the disease for this particular sample, not for the donor health condition. The NCImetathesaurus term C0277545 “Disease type AND/OR category unknown” should be used for unknown diseases. Phenotypes associated with the disease should be submitted as DISEASE_ONTOLOGY_CURIEs (if available) or in the free form DISEASE attribute. For samples without any known disease, use the NCImetathesaurus C0549184 term 'None'. If dealing with a rare disease consider identifiability issues.

disease.description: Free form field for more specific sample disease information. This property reflects the disease for this particular sample, not for the donor health condition. If dealing with a rare disease consider identifiability issues.

biomaterial_provider.description: The name of the company, laboratory or person that provided the biological material.

biomaterial_type.description: The type of the biosample used (Cell Line, Primary Cell, Primary Cell Culture, Primary Tissue)

treatment.description: Any artificial modification (differentiation, activation, genome editing, etc).

biological_replicates.description: List of biological replicate sample accessions

line.description: The name of the cell line.

lineage.description: The developmental lineage to which the cell line belongs.

differentiation_stage.description: The stage in cell differentiation to which the cell line belongs.

differentiation_method.description: The protocol used to differentiation the cell line.

passage.description: The number of times the cell line has been re-plated and allowed to grow back to confluency or to some maximum density if using suspension cultures.

medium.description: The medium in which the cell line has been grown.

batch.description: The batch from which the cell line is derived. Primarily applicable to initial H1 cell line batches. NA if not applicable.

origin_sample_ontology_curie.description: (Ontology: UBERON) links to the tissue from which sample was extracted.

origin_sample.description: Description of the origin tissue from which sample was extracted.

markers.description: Markers used to isolate and identify the cell type.

passage_if_expanded.description: If the primary cell has been expanded, the number of times the primary cell has been re-plated and allowed to grow back to confluency or to some maximum density if using suspension cultures. NA if no expansion.

origin_sample_ontology_curie.description: (Ontology: UBERON) links to the tissue from which sample was extracted.

origin_sample.description: Description of the origin tissue from which sample was extracted.

markers.description: Markers used to isolate and identify the cell type.

culture_conditions.description: The conditions under which the primary cell was cultured.

passage_if_expanded.description: If the primary cell culture has been expanded, the number of times the primary cell culture has been re-plated and allowed to grow back to confluency or to some maximum density if using suspension cultures. NA if no expansion.

tissue_depot.description: Details about the anatomical location from which the primary tissue was collected.

collection_method.description: The protocol for collecting the primary tissue.

donor.description: Additional set of properties for samples coming from a donor.

donor_id.description: An identifying designation for the donor that provided the cells/tissues.

donor_age.description: The age of the donor that provided the cells/tissues. NA if not available. If over 90 years enter as 90+. If entering a range of ages use the format “{age}-{age}”.

donor_age_unit.description: The unit of measurement used to describe the age of the sample (year, month, week, day, gestational weeks)

donor_life_stage.description: One of: embryonic, fetal, postnatal, newborn, child, adult, unknown

donor_health_status.description: The health status of the donor that provided the primary cell. NA if not available.

donor_health_status_ontology_curie.description: (Ontology: NCIM) Links to the health status of the donor that provided the primary cell. The NCImetathesaurus term C0277545 'Disease type AND/OR category unknown' should be used for unknown diseases. For samples without any known disease, use the NCImetathesaurus term C0549184 'None'. Phenotypes associated with the disease should be submitted as DISEASE_ONTOLOGY_CURIEs (if available) or in the free form DISEASE attribute. If dealing with a rare disease, please consider identifiability issues.

donor_sex.description: One of: 'Male', 'Female', 'Unknown', or 'Mixed' for pooled samples.

donor_ethnicity.description: The ethnicity of the donor that provided the primary cell. NA if not available. If dealing with small/vulnerable populations consider identifiability issues.
